TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PrintWriter extends Java.IO.Writer

Docs.summary: Prints formatted representations of objects to a text-output stream.

remarks.para: Prints formatted representations of objects to a text-output stream. This class implements all of the print methods found in PrintStream. It does not contain methods for writing raw bytes, for which a program should use unencoded byte streams.

Unlike the PrintStream class, if automatic flushing is enabled it will be done only when one of the println, printf, or format methods is invoked, rather than whenever a newline character happens to be output. These methods use the platform's own notion of line separator rather than the newline character.
Methods in this class never throw I/O exceptions, although some of its constructors may. The client may inquire as to whether any errors have occurred by invoking #checkError checkError().

This class always replaces malformed and unmappable character sequences with the charset's default replacement string. The java.nio.charset.CharsetEncoder class should be used when more control over the encoding process is required.
Added in 1.1.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Sub New (file As File)
public: PrintWriter(Java::IO::File ^ file);
public PrintWriter (Java.IO.File file);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Java.IO.File file) cil managed
new Java.IO.PrintWriter : Java.IO.File -> Java.IO.PrintWriter

Docs.param: The file to use as the destination of this writer. If the file exists then it will be truncated to zero size; otherwise, a new file will be created. The output will be written to the file and is buffered.
Docs.summary: Creates a new PrintWriter, without automatic line flushing, with the specified file.

remarks.para: Creates a new PrintWriter, without automatic line flushing, with the specified file. This convenience constructor creates the necessary intermediate java.io.OutputStreamWriter OutputStreamWriter, which will encode characters using the java.nio.charset.Charset#defaultCharset() default charset for this instance of the Java virtual machine.
Added in 1.5.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs while opening or creating the target file.

Docs.summary: Clears the error state of this stream.

remarks.para: Clears the error state of this stream.

Added in 1.6.

Docs.param: A format string as described in Format string syntax.

Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string. If there are more arguments than format specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as defined by The Java™ Virtual Machine Specification. The behaviour on a null argument depends on the conversion.
Docs.summary: Writes a formatted string to this writer using the specified format string and arguments.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

remarks.para: Prints an object. The string produced by the java.lang.String#valueOf(Object) method is translated into bytes according to the platform's default character encoding, and these bytes are written in exactly the manner of the #write(int) method.

public virtual Java.IO.PrintWriter Printf (string format, params Java.Lang.Object[] args);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.IO.PrintWriter Printf(string format, class Java.Lang.Object[] args) cil managed
abstract member Printf : string * Java.Lang.Object[] -> Java.IO.PrintWriter override this.Printf : string * Java.Lang.Object[] -> Java.IO.PrintWriter

Docs.param: A format string as described in Format string syntax.

Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string. If there are more arguments than format specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of arguments is variable and may be zero. The maximum number of arguments is limited by the maximum dimension of a Java array as defined by The Java™ Virtual Machine Specification. The behaviour on a null argument depends on the conversion.
Docs.summary: A convenience method to write a formatted string to this writer using the specified format string and arguments.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub Println ()
public: virtual void Println();
public virtual void Println ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Println() cil managed
abstract member Println : unit -> unit override this.Println : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Terminates the current line by writing the line separator string.

remarks.para: Terminates the current line by writing the line separator string. The line separator string is defined by the system property line.separator, and is not necessarily a single newline character ('\n').
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

abstract member Println : Java.Lang.Object -> unit override this.Println : Java.Lang.Object -> unit

Docs.summary: Prints an Object and then terminates the line.

remarks.para: Prints an Object and then terminates the line. This method calls at first String.valueOf(x) to get the printed object's string value, then behaves as though it invokes #print(String) and then #println().
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
